title: Praça Amílcar Cabral
text:
Praça Amílcar Cabral, also popularly known as Praça Nova (Portuguese for "new square"), is an important square of the city of <a href="Mindelo">Mindelo</a>, <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Vicente%2C%20Cape%20Verde">São Vicente</a>, <a href="Cape%20Verde">Cape Verde</a>. It is located in the northern part of the <a href="city%20center%20of%20Mindelo">city center of Mindelo</a>. The square is named after <a href="Am%C3%ADlcar%20Cabral">Amílcar Cabral</a>, a leader of the independence movement of Cape Verde and <a href="Guinea-Bissau">Guinea-Bissau</a>. Constructed in 1895, it was named after the colonial administrator <a href="Serpa%20Pinto">Serpa Pinto</a> until Cape Verdean independence in 1975. It was laid out in a new, previously undeveloped part of the town. The square is surrounded by Rua Angola to the north, Rua Argelia to the east, Rua Patrice Lumumba to the south and Rua 5 de Julho to the west.
